name: Indigenous Leadership, Policy and Practices in Canada
description: A historical and contemporary overview of leadership and politics in First Nation, Inuit and Metis communities in Canada. This course will focus on pre-contact governance structures, contemporary effects of colonization, and processes and strategies for decolonization. Various policy initiatives from Indigenous organizations will be examined.
prerequisites: 5 FCE, including INS201Y1 and one additional INS designator full course equivalent.
